login.description:
login to a Salesforce account or enviornment

  Login to https://login.salesforce.com in a browser. To login to different providers (Salesforce org, heroku, commerce cloud, mulesoft, etc) sepecify the domain or login url of the service. For example, '--instance-url=heroku.com'.

alias.name: alias
alias.description: set an alias for the environment - see all aliases using `sf env alias list`

client-id.name: client-id
client-id.description: OAuth client ID (sometimes called the consumer key)

expires-in.name: expires-in
expires-in.description: duration of token in seconds if supported by the auth provider (default 1 year)

login-url.name: login-url
login-url.description: the login url of the auth provider

reset.description: reset data created by this CLI

whoami.description:
who the CLI thinks you are

  Get information on accounts that have been logged into.

name.name: name
name.description: name of the remote environment to connect to

alias.name: alias
alias.description: alias to give to the environment

env:list.description:
list connected enviornment

  List connected environment including Salesforce orgs, heroku apps, and compute enviornments (functions). Use --remote to display all environments you have access to.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: property to sort by (prepend '-' for descending)

filter.name: filter
filter.description: filter property by partial string matching, ex: name=foo

output.name: output
output.description: output in a more machine friendly format

no-truncate.name: no-truncate
no-truncate.description: do not truncate output to fit screen

login:jwt.description:
headlessly login to a Salesforce organization using JSON Web Tokens

  Login using a JSON Web Tokens from a provided username, client id, and private key. Only Salesforce organizations support this flow.

alias.name: alias
alias.description: set an alias for the account or environment

client-id.name: client-id
client-id.description: OAuth client ID (sometimes called the consumer key)

login-url.name: login-url
login-url.description: the login url of the auth provider

private-key-file.name: private-key-file
private-key-file.description: path to a file containing the private key

project:deploy.description:
deploy a Salesforce project

  Deploy a project, including org metadata and functions. Be default, the deploy analyize your project and assume sensible defaults when possible, otherwise it will prompt. To always prompt and not assume defaults, use "--interctive".

  To run specialized deploys, especially when interactivity isn't an option like continuious deployment, used the scoped deploy commands like "sf project deploy org" or "sf project deploy functions"
